SENT.plain: A 56-year-old man presented with sudden-onset oropharyngeal dysphagia and vomiting of central etiology
Neurological evaluation showed uvula deviation to the left, paresis of the mid-right portion of the soft palate, lateralization of gaze to the right side, and dysphonia
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed an infarction in the left lateral medullary region, therefore the diagnosis of Wallenberg's syndrome was established
The neurological issues along with the dysphagia gradually improved and the patient was discharged
